intro: Iryanthera elongata, commonly known as the elongated hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. Iryanthera elongata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
